entry.title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit

media:group.media:title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit
media:group.media:description:
üìç The U.S. Secretary of State Anthony Blinken cautioned Azerbaijan that there is no justification for increased tension on the border ahead of a major Armenia-EU-U.S. summit. üìç Russia again called on all sides to show restraint as tensions between Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to escalate. üìç Armenia expects a Russian-led military alliance to confirm Azerbaijan is occupying parts of the country, a senior Armenian diplomat said. üìç Israeli police officers and settlers clashed with Armenian activists in Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenian Quarter amid ongoing tensions over a contentious lease deal.

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Balancing Act In Brussels
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet host Patrick Elliot sits down with political commentator Eric Hacopian to talk about the upcoming Armenia-US-EU meeting in Brussels, as well as the Russian and Azerbaijani reactions. They also touch on the issue of the four border villages in Tavush, and finally, the recent string of terrorist actions in Armenia.

entry.title: Pashinyan denies any misstep regarding Russia relations

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan denies any misstep regarding Russia relations
media:group.media:description:
üìç Pashinyan insisted Armenia has not done anything wrong in its relations with Russia. üìç The French prime minister rebuked Azerbaijan for taking steps which threaten Armenia‚Äôs territorial integrity. üìç A former Nagorno-Karabakh official who remained behind in Stepanakert after the rest of the population fled voluntarily returned to Armenia and was charged with espionage. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry expressed deep concern over Israel‚Äôs attack on the Iranian consulate in Damascus.
